name: Eggnog Loaf Cake
author: Mary E. Crain
summary: This cake gets better with age. It tastes like Christmas! Smaller loaves make excellent gifts. Use fresh eggnog, not the canned stuff.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease bottom only of a 9x5 inch loaf pan, or three 6x3 inch loaf pans
Stir in sugar, melted butter, eggnog, rum extract, and vanilla
Combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg
Stir into eggnog mixture, just enough to moisten dry ingredients
Pour batter into prepared pan or pans
Bake bread in large pan for 40 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean
Breads baked in the smaller pans require 25 to 40 minutes
Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack, and cool completely
Wrap tightly, and store in the refrigerator
